thread.title: Warning over three products recalled from Boots, Asda and Poundland
thread.title_full: Warning over three products recalled from Boots, Asda and Poundland

author: Caroline Jones
title: Warning over three products recalled from Boots, Asda and Poundland
text:
News Warning over three products recalled from Boots, Asda and Poundland There are urgent warnings over Little Dish's Pasta Bolognese healthy kids meal, Liz Earle SuperskinTM Concentrate for Night and the Lumie Balloony light up colour change balloon Share The Little Dish healthy kids meal has been recalled Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Shoppers are being warning over three products being sold at Asda , Boots and Poundland which have been recalled. 
According to the Food Standards Agency, Little Dish has recalled its Pasta Bolognese because the product contains milk which is not declared on the label. 
The Derby Telegraph reports that shoppers at Asda are affected by the news - which covers the whole of the UK. 
An agency spokesman said: "This means the product is a possible health risk for anyone with an allergy or intolerance to milk and milk constituents. 
"If you have bought the above product and have an allergy or intolerance to milk or milk constituents, do not eat it. 
"Instead return it to the store from where it was bought for a full refund. Asda customers are being warned over the healthy kids meal (Photo: Gary Louth/Accrington Observer) 
"Little Dish is recalling the product from customers and has contacted the relevant allergy support organisations, which will tell their members about the recall. 
"The company has also issued a point-of-sale notice to its customers. These notices explain to customers why the product is being recalled and tells them what to do if they have bought the product. 
"This batch is only sold in ASDA stores. No other ASDA products are known to be affected." 
The product details are: Little Dish Pasta Bolognese; pack size: 300 grams; use-by date: February 19, 2017, and February 20, 2017; batch code: 17015; barcode: 5060121671584. There are worries over the Liz Earle product (Photo: Derby Telegraph / SWNS) 
Meanwhile, the Chartered Trading Standards Institute said Boots had issued a notice because of a recall of Liz Earle SuperskinTM Concentrate for Night 2ml. 
The product recall notice said: "Liz Earle Beauty Co. are disappointed to let you know about a safety issue they have discovered with SuperskinTM Concentrate for Night 2ml, an item included in Liz Earle The Botanist's Cabinet (67-36-165). 
"They recently became aware that small traces of glass have been found in one batch of this product (batch number 6T). 
"As a precautionary measure, they are recalling all products with batch numbers 6T, 6F,6P and ask you to stop using it and dispose of it. 
"Please visit your nearest Liz Earle counter to obtain a replacement, an alternative product, or a refund. The skin product is sold at Boots (Photo: Getty) Read More Mum finds note in kid's lunchbox from teacher shaming her meal choice 
"The batch code can be found on the cap of the vial and on the outer sleeve. Liz Earle Beauty Co. are committed to providing you with the highest quality and service always. 
"No other products in The Botanist's Cabinet or any other Liz Earle Beauty Co. products have been affected. 
"If you do have any concerns or need any further advice, then please speak to an advisor at your nearest Liz Earle Counter or contact the Liz Earle Beauty Co. Customer Centre on: by email: naturallyactive@lizearle.com and by phone: UK 0800 413 318 / ROI 1800 937 540. 
"Liz Earle Beauty Co. offer their sincere apologies for any inconvenience that may be caused. If you've bought this for someone else, please let them know about this as soon as possible." There are safety concerns over the Lumie Balloony (Photo: Derby Telegraph / SWNS) 
Finally, a product recall notice has been issued by Poundworld for the Lumie Balloony light up colour change balloon. 
It said: "Poundworld has identified a potential safety issue with the product. Customer safety and satisfaction are of paramount importance to us; therefore we have issued this product recall. 
"Please stop using the product immediately and return the item to any Poundworld or Poundworld Plus store - our stores will issue you with a refund or exchange. Poundworld shoppers are urged to return the balloon toy (file pic) (Photo: PA) Read More Price hikes could see families facing further food shortages as veg crisis deepens 
"If you have purchased this product for anyone else, then please inform him or her of this recall and they can also return the product as above. 
"No other Poundworld product is affected by this notice - we apologise sincerely for any inconvenience caused and thank our customers for their co-operation." 
The product details are: Lumie Balloony light up colour change LED balloon - 5 pack; product code: V-84511; barcode: 505057784511. Like us on Facebook
